column4: does anyone have comparisons of writing to ipod from itunes versus from something in linux? which is faster? (wondering if I should run wine+itunes on linux)
unless you have some FairPlay DRM'd songs, I'd go with rhythmbox or equivalent
is there any program to strip the DRM from the songs?
there's a windows/osx app, but it'll only work for <= iTunes 5.00 stuff
you need to install an SMP kernel
assuming you're using an AMD dual core, try 'sudo aptitude install linux-k7-smp'
what's the difference between an SMP kernel and i386?
SMP =multi-processing :)
probably, almost definitely, yes
if you installed it using the ubuntu packages you shouldn't have much of a problem though
yes, no way around it, SMP = more than one CPU
if you're using the ubuntu Nvidia drivers though (didn't install your own by hand), you shouldn't even notice the change though
k7 is 32-bit
k8 is 64-bit
slackern ok, I guess it's time to upgrade the kernel... I had compiz+xgl working on this install and if I have to reset it up again, I'm gonna be really mad
so long as you've done things "the ubuntu way", you shouldn't have a problem
how do I change the kernel anyways?
just do 'sudo aptitude install linux-k7-smp' at a terminal
what's the difference between aptitude and apt-get?
not much, aptitude was (a few years back when I first learned this), the newer way of doing things though
so it stuck with me ^_^ use what you prefer
